column4: hey guys, my friend has a toshiba satellite A25 that doesnt show anything at all when booting the install CD; is there some kernel argument i can pass at the boot: prompt to get like a failsafe mode or something?
, did you burn the image right, or are you using the official ubuntu cd?
also, my friend complained when he uses the 64 version of ubuntu, he told me off, but then he smiled
zoo: i've tried with a burned 5.10 and a shipped 5.04 and they both dont work
i just want a vga safe mode
i see
try drake m8
bu ti will say, not every distribution is perfect, and all are different, etc..
dude
not installing mandrake
you might want to try knoppix
Zoo i need to install *ubuntu* on this machine
not knoppix
you don't ness need to do anything
are you forcing yourself to install ubuntu or what?
zoo, i'm just looking for the boot parameter to use a failsafe vga mode, THAT'S ALL
oh do..
vga=791
okay..
you might try as well..  apci=off
drake's quite diff, from previous versions of ubuntu < I will say that :-)

, if you don't mind trying out Dapper Drake, I encourage ya, it might help ya for now.. I like it alot, and I am chaning alot of things as we speak, run levels, etc.. services, booting, graphics, adding , taking out , remember when like.. Bruce Willis was like, whats this ? a plastic ice cream scoop.. :-)
